fluff.name: The Mesmer
entries: In the heart of a bustling city, a cloaked figure dances through the shadows, their footsteps silent against the cobblestone. With a flick of their wrist, illusions spring to life, weaving a tapestry of deception that leaves onlookers in awe and adversaries in confusion.

Amidst the chaos of battle, a serene warrior stands untouched, their enemies bewildered as their strikes meet only mirages. With a gentle whisper, the Mesmer bends the perception of friend and foe alike, shaping the battlefield with an artist’s precision and a tactician’s cunning.

Mesmers are masters of illusion, manipulation, and mental magic, blurring the lines between reality and fantasy. While some spellcasters rely on brute force or elemental power, a Mesmer’s strength lies in subtlety and finesse, influencing the world around them with delicate, yet potent, manipulations of the mind.

entries.name: The Art of Illusion
entries: To a Mesmer, reality is but a canvas for their artistry. They craft illusions with such detail and depth that even the most discerning eye can be fooled. These illusions can protect allies, ensnare enemies, or simply beguile the senses. The most skilled Mesmers can make their illusions so convincing they can inflict physical harm, blurring the lines between the mental and the material.

entries.name: Mental Dominion
entries: Mesmers wield control over minds with unparalleled grace, manipulating memories, emotions, and perceptions. They can soothe the weary, inspire the despondent, or sow chaos among their enemies. This mental dominion extends to themselves, allowing Mesmers to maintain clarity in the face of confusion and resist attempts to ensnare their own minds.

entries.name: Creating a Mesmer
entries: When creating a Mesmer, consider how they discovered their unique talents. Were they born with an innate ability to perceive the fabric of reality differently, or did they learn their skills from a mentor, honing their craft through study and practice? Think about how your character uses their abilities - do they perform in grand theaters, deceive their way through political intrigue, or employ their skills in service of a greater cause?

Consider also your character’s attitude towards their powers. Do they view their illusions as an art form, a weapon, or a tool for change? How do they feel about the ethical implications of manipulating perception and memory?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can quickly build a Mesmer by following these suggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by Charisma or Dexterity. Second, choose the {@spell minor illusion}, {@spell charm person}, and {@spell disguise self} cantrips to start embodying the Mesmer's capabilities in manipulating both mind and senses.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a master of illusion and mental manipulation, you can cast mesmer spells. Your magic weaves complex illusions and manipulates the minds of those around you, bending perceptions to your will and controlling the flow of battle through cunning and subtlety.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the {@filter mesmer spell list|spells|class=mesmer (AGI)}. You gain additional mesmer cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Mesmer table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Mesmer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your mesmer spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of mesmer spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the {@filter mesmer spell list|spells|class=mesmer (AGI)}. When you do so, choose a number of mesmer spells equal to your Intelligence modifier + your mesmer level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level mesmer, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell illusionary force}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of mesmer spells requires time spent in meditation and mental exercises: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your mesmer spells, as your magic hinges on your ability to deceive, manipulate, and outsmart. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a mesmer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast any mesmer spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item arcane focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your mesmer spells. Mesmers often use objects that reflect their personal flair and the theatrical nature of their magic, such as mirrors, masks, or crystal orbs, as their arcane focuses. To use such an item, you must spend an hour in concentration, imbuing it with your magical essence.

classFeature.name: Replicate
entries: Harnessing your mastery over illusion, you have the unique ability to create and manipulate clones of yourself to confuse, distract, and damage your enemies. These replicas are fundamental to your tactics, providing both offensive and defensive capabilities.

entries.name: Clone Creation
entries: At 1st level, you gain the Replicate ability, allowing you to create clones. A clone mimics your actions and serves as a distraction, it has the same AC as you had at the moment it was created, having 1 hit point and causing attacks against it to be made with disadvantage. It uses your modifiers to make saving throws.
At any point, you can have as many clones active as your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Mirror Image
entries: Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can create a clone of yourself in an unoccupied space within 30 feet. The clone lasts for 1 minute or until destroyed.

entries.name: Decoy
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, create a clone in your space that lasts for 1 minute or until destroyed. You can then move up to your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: I'm The Real One!!!
entries: At the end of your turn, you can command one of your clones to make a single attack against a target within its range. Make a melee spell attack against a target within 5ft of a clone. On a hit, it deals psychic damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Shatter
entries: At 2nd level, your mastery over illusions deepens, granting you the power to shatter your clones for devastating effects. Each shatter ability triggers a unique effect that scales with the number of clones you shatter.

entries.name: Shatter Style
entries: Using a bonus action, you can shatter any number of your active clones within 60 feet. The effects of shattering are enhanced by the number of clones shattered, making your illusions more than mere distractions.

entries.name: Mind Wrack
entries: Shatter your clones to deal psychic damage to all enemies adjacent to each clone. Damage each clone deals increases with the number of clones: {@dice 1d6} for one clone, {@dice 2d6} for two clones, doubling the dice for each additional clone shattered.

entries.name: Cry of Frustration
entries: Shatter your clones to inflict confusion on enemies near the clones. Each creature that is adjacent to a clone must make a wisdom saving throw or be {@i confused} till the end of its next turn. Creatures next to multiple clones need to make multiple saving throws.

A {@i confused} creature on its turn is muddled with defening thoughts as the clones cries ring out. It may use its action to focus and end the confusion. If it uses its action, bonus action, movement or reaction to do anything else while confused, it takes {@dice 1d8} psychic damage and the confusion ends. The damage increases with the number of clones shattered. {@dice 1d8} for 1 clone, {@dice 2d8} for 2 clones and so on.

entries.name: Diversion
entries: Shatter your clones to daze and disrupts your enemies. Each creature that is adjacent to a clone must make a dexterity saving throw or immediately lose thier reactions. Creatures next to multiple clones need to make multiple saving throws. If a creature was concentrating, it also needs to make a contitution saving throw to maintain concentration. The DC for which is enhanced by the number of clones you shatter. DC 10 + Shattered clones.

entries.name: Distortion
entries: Shatter your clones to and grant yourself a moment of invulnerability. You gain a pool of {@dice d6}'s that you can use to reduce damage dealt to you. The pool is as large as the number of clones shattered.
When you take damage, you can roll dice from this pool and reduce the damage by that amount after any reductions from resistance.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Illusory Onslaught
entries: At 6th level, your mastery over illusions allows you to weave them into more complex and damaging forms. Your illusions are now capable of executing a simultaneous attack, overwhelming your foes with a barrage of strikes from multiple angles.

entries.name: Enhanced Clone Attack
entries: Whenever you use your 'I'm The Real One!!!' ability to command one of your clones to attack, you can now make a second attack with another clone against the same target or a different one within range. Each attack uses your spell attack modifier and deals psychic damage equal to 1d4 + your Intelligence modifier. This ability represents your clones' enhanced capacity to harm, further blurring the line between illusion and reality.

entries.name: Tactical Reposition
entries: In addition, whenever you create a clone using any of your abilities, you can choose to swap places with any one of your existing clones on the battlefield. This swap can be triggered once per turn, allowing you to reposition strategically without provoking opportunity attacks, enhancing your battlefield mobility and deceit.

classFeature.name: Master of Mirrors
entries: At 18th level, your command over illusions allows you to manipulate the fabric of reality itself. You become a Master of Mirrors, able to create perfect reflections of reality that can harm, protect, or deceive.

entries.name: Reality's Reflection
entries: As an action, you can create a mirrored area on the battlefield up to 30 feet in diameter within 120 feet of you. This area becomes a reflection of reality for 1 minute. Enemies within the area are subjected to disorienting visions, granting advantage on attacks against them. Allies within the area receive a reflection of themselves that can take a single hit in their stead, disappearing afterward.

entries.name: Mirror Walk
entries: Once per long rest, you can step into one mirror and emerge from another within 1 mile that you have seen before. This teleportation can be used to traverse great distances instantly, escape danger, or enter secured locations.

entries.name: Ultimate Shatter
entries: You gain the ability to perform an Ultimate Shatter, instantly ending all of your active illusions and causing a massive explosion of psychic energy. Each enemy within 30 feet of a shattered illusion takes 10d6 psychic damage, and must make an Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until the end of their next turn. This ability can be used once per long rest.

classFeature.name: Quantum Illusionist
entries: At 20th level, you achieve the pinnacle of illusion mastery, becoming a Quantum Illusionist. Your understanding of reality, illusion, and the space between allows you to manipulate the fabric of existence itself, altering outcomes to your advantage.

entries.name: Quantum Flux
entries: Once per long rest, as an action, you can activate Quantum Flux. For the next minute, you gain the following benefits:
- You can reroll any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or against you, choosing the preferred outcome.
- When you or any of your allies within 60 feet of you take damage, you can use your reaction to halve that damage.
- You can teleport up to 30 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Reality Warp
entries: In addition, you gain the ability to cast the spell 'wish' once, without needing material components. After you use this ability, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

classFeature.name: Mesmer Elite Specialization
entries: At 3rd level, Mesmers choose a specialization that provides unique abilities and enhancements:

items: Chronomancer: Masters of time, Chronomancers can manipulate the flow of battle, offering abilities like speeding up ally actions or creating temporal fields that slow enemies.
Mirage: Specializing in deception, Mirages gain abilities to evade attacks, create more convincing illusions, and even make their clones perform semi-independent actions.
Illusionist: Focusing on the potency of their illusions, Illusionists enhance the durability and effects of their clones, and gain abilities that make their shattering effects more devastating.

entries.name: Choosing Your Path
entries: When you choose your specialization at 3rd level, you gain specific abilities related to that path. These abilities are designed to complement and enhance your existing Mesmer skills, providing new tactical options and strategies.

classFeature.name: Elite Specialization
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Elite Specialization.

classFeature.name: Elite Specialization
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Elite Specialization.

classFeature.name: Elite Specialization
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Elite Specialization.

classFeature.name: Echoes of Infinity
entries: Achieving level 21, you unlock the ability to call upon your alternate selves from different realities for assistance, manifesting the true power of a Quantum Illusionist.

entries.name: Multiversal Assistance
entries: Once per long rest, as an action, you can summon an echo of yourself from an alternate reality. This echo appears within 30 feet of you and possesses all the abilities and spells you have but cannot use 'Echoes of Infinity'. It acts on your initiative and follows your commands mentally. The echo lasts for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hit points.

classFeature.name: Paradoxical Existence
entries: At 22nd level, your grasp on the fabric of reality allows you to blur the lines between presence and absence, existing in multiple realities simultaneously.

entries.name: Ubiquitous Presence
entries: You can spend 10 minutes to create a duplicate of yourself that lasts for 24 hours. This duplicate can perform any action you can, including spellcasting, but it cannot create another duplicate with 'Paradoxical Existence'. You can have up to two duplicates at any time, and you share a mental link, allowing you to see through their eyes and communicate.
If a duplicate is killed, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion. Duplicates disappear if they are killed or when the duration ends.

optionalfeature.name: Blaze Reprisal

3-4: Attacks cause targets to ignite, dealing {@dice 1d8} fire damage at the start of their next turn.
5: Attacks create a blaze around the target, dealing {@dice 2d8} fire damage to enemies within 10 feet.
6: Unleash a fiery explosion, dealing {@dice 4d8} fire damage to all enemies within 30 feet of you. Requires a Dexterity saving throw.

3-4: Attacks slow the target, reducing their speed by 10 feet until your next turn.

6: Encase targets in ice on hit, {@condition stunned} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.

3-4: Attacks push enemies back 10 feet.
5: Gain advantage on all Dexterity saving throws and skill checks.
6: Create a tempest on hit, dealing {@dice 2d8} lightning damage to the target and up to two additional enemies within 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Bulwark

3-4: Attacks fortify you, granting temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier.
5: Attacks cause the earth to grasp enemies, reducing their speed to 0 until the end of their next turn.
6: Trigger a localized earthquake, knocking enemies within 20 feet prone. Requires a Strength saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Void Embrace

3-4: Diminish enemy strength, reducing their damage output by {@dice 1d4} for 1 turn.
5: Silence enemies hit, preventing them from casting spells for 1 turn. Requires a Wisdom saving throw.
6: Consume life force, dealing {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage to all enemies within 15 feet. You gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Solar Flare
entries: 1-2: Add {@dice 1d6} radiant damage to attacks. Dispel magical darkness in a 10-foot radius.
3-4: Illuminate targets, granting advantage on attacks against them and dealing {@dice 1d6} additional radiant damage.
5: Enemies hit are {@condition blinded} for 1 turn. Requires a Constitution saving throw.
6: A radiant burst expands from you, blinding all enemies within 20 feet and dealing {@dice 3d8} radiant damage. Requires a Constitution saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Aether Wind
entries: 1-2: Attacks extend your reach by 5 feet and add {@dice 1d4} force damage.
3-4: Generate an updraft with each hit, allowing you to ignore difficult terrain.
5: Gain a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 turn.
6: Create a vortex on hit, pulling up to three enemies within 30 feet towards the target. Requires a Strength saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Bind
entries: 1-2: Attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} poison damage and slow enemies by 10 feet.
3-4: Entangle enemies hit, reducing their speed to 0 until they succeed on a Strength saving throw.
5: Vines grapple the target, {@condition restraining} them for 1 turn. Requires a Strength saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: The Mysticshift Duelist
entries: Originating from the elite Cassius recon groups, Mysticshift Duelists blend emerging scientific insights and a deepening arcane understanding, born from a world where the weave of magic is unraveling. These pioneers of martial and mystical arts integrated newfound arcane knowledge into their combat techniques, crafting a refined martial art that harmonizes elemental forces with physical prowess. Over the years, their practices spread beyond Cassius, evolving into a distinguished discipline. Today, Mysticshift Duelists are renowned warriors who embody the art of transformation, leveraging elemental stances to dynamically adapt in combat. Their path demands a profound comprehension of both the elements and one's inner self, attracting those intrigued by the challenge of mastering such versatile and potent powers.

subclassFeature.name: Arms of the Mysticshift
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}

Upon embarking on the path of the Mysticshift Duelist, you commit to mastering the art of combat through both traditional weaponry and the precise application of firearms. This unique synthesis of martial disciplines forms the foundation of your journey, preparing you for the eventual creation of your signature weapon—the Elemental Gunblade.

At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with one {@filter melee weapon|items|category=basic|type=melee weapon} and one {@filter firearm|items|category=basic|type=firearm;modern;renaissance} of your choice. These weapons become the focal point of your training, each representing one half of the duality you seek to master. Through rigorous practice, you learn to channel elemental energies into every strike and shot, laying the groundwork for the fusion of these disciplines.

Your dedication to mastering both the blade and the bullet grants you unique combat advantages. When wielding your chosen melee weapon or firearm, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and the attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcomming resistance.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Stance Initiation
entries: {@i 3rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}

Starting at 3rd level, you gain the ability to adopt elemental stances, each offering unique enhancements to your attacks. When you make a weapon attack, you may choose one of your stances to activate it, adding the effects from the stance if it hits. Repeated attacks made with the same stance grants additional effects stacking based on the number of successful attacks made. Switching stances resets the stacks to 0.
The saving throw DC for stance effects is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (whichever is higher).
Select two stances initially, you may choose an additional stance when you reach the 7th, 10th and 15th level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of Blade and Bullet
entries: {@i 7rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}

At 7th level, you gain the ability to combine your chosen melee weapon and firearm into a singular, powerful weapon: the Elemental Gunblade. This fusion requires a ritual that spans a day and a night, during which you must channel elemental energies into the weapons, binding them with your own spirit. The resulting Elemental Gunblade is a masterwork of craftsmanship and arcane power, unique to you and unusable by anyone else.

Upon completing the ritual, you gain proficiency with your Elemental Gunblade, which retains the properties of both the original melee weapon and firearm. The elemental gunblade also counts as one of your chosen weapons and benefits from the +1 bonus to attack rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Reverb
entries: At 7th level, you gain the ability to instantly channel the full force of an Elemental Stance through your Gunblade. Once per short rest, as part of an attack, you can apply one of your known stance's max stack effect on your target.

Additionally, when you switch stances from max stacks, the energy release emits a 15-foot radius elemental shockwave, dealing {@dice 2d8} force damage and pushing creatures of your choice back 5 feet on a failed Dexterity save.

subclassFeature.name: Stance Weaving
entries: {@i 7rd-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}
By 7th level, you have mastered the ability to shift between your known elemental stances in such rapid fluidity that they have begun to weave more effectively.

As a bonus action on your turn, you enter a perfect weave state for 1 minute. If you have a stance active, you gain 5 stacks in it immediately. While in this state, when you switch to a new stance the effects from the previous one linger until the next switch. You must also switch stances every turn to keep perfect weave active. You lose perfect weave at the end of your turn if you have not switched stances atleast once.
You may enter this state as many times as your proficiency bonus and uses recharge on a short rest

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Resilience
entries: {@i 10th-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}
Your mastery over the elemental forces not only empowers your attacks but also fortifies your resolve and vitality. This mastery manifests in two key ways:

items: Defensive Harmony: You gain a bonus to all saving throws equal to half the number of stacks (rounded down)       you have in any stance. This bonus reflects your heightened elemental awareness, enhancing your ability to evade or withstand harmful effects.

Elemental Transference: When you switch stances, the accumulated elemental energy rejuvenates you, healing you for an amount equal to the number of stacks in the previous stance before the switch. This healing represents the restorative power of the elements flowing through you, a reward for your strategic mastery over the elemental stances.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Gunblade Ascendance
entries: {@i 15th-level Mysticshift Duelist feature}
Your mastery of the elemental stances allows you to unleash a devastating Ascendant Attack, channeling the full might of your chosen element through your Elemental Gunblade.

Upon reaching the maximum stacks in an elemental stance twice in a row, you gain the ability to perform an Ascendant Attack associated with that stance for the next one minute. You may use this special ascendant attack in place of one of your extra attacks. These powerful attacks can be used once per long rest for each stance.
The Ascendant Attacks are as follows:

items: Inferno Vortex (Blaze Reprisal Stance): Create a 30-foot radius vortex of fire at a point you can see within 120 feet. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The area becomes difficult terrain, and creatures that fail the save are also {@condition blinded} by the intense flames for 1 minute. An affected creature at the end of each of its turns may repeat the saving throw to try and end the blindness.

Frost Sigil (Glacial Guard): Summon a sigil on the ground within a 60-foot radius. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} cold damage on a failed save and becoming {@condition slowed} for 1 minute on a failed save. The ground becomes difficult terrain. An affected creature at the end of each of its turns may repeat the saving throw to try and end the slowness.

Lightning Tempest (Tempest Fury): Target up to three creatures you can see within 150 feet. Each must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 5d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Affected creatures are also {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

Earthshaker Pulse (Stone Bulwark): Cause an earthquake in a 50-foot radius around you. Enemies must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition knocked prone} and take {@dice 4d6} bludgeoning damage. The affected area becomes difficult terrain.

Abyssal Drain (Void Embrace): Release a 20-foot radius wave of dark energy. Enemies within range must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@dice 5d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You gain temporary hit points equal to the highest damage dealt to one target.

Radiant Dawn (Solar Flare): Emit a 60-foot radius burst of radiant light. Enemies within the burst must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute and take {@dice 5d6} radiant damage. Allies in the area gain temporary hit points equal to your fighter level. An affected creature at the end of each of its turns may repeat the saving throw to try and end the blindness.

Galeforce Dash (Aether Wind): Transform into a gust of wind, moving up to 100 feet in a line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 4d6} force damage on a failed save, and is {@condition pushed} 15 feet to the side of the line on a failed save.

Verdant Cataclysm (Nature's Bind): Cause a 40-foot radius of thorny vines to erupt. Creatures in the area must make a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} and take {@dice 4d6} piercing damage at the start of each of their turns. On a success, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest unoccupied space outside the vines. The area becomes difficult terrain.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Resonance
entries: At 18th level, select an elemental stance at dawn; its base effect is always on. When you hit max stacks on your selected stance, you can activate Elemental Resonance for 1 minute, maximizing your chosen stance's effects without needing stacks on each attack. This power surge ends if you're incapacitated or prone.
Once Elemental resonance ends, you may use it again after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Infusion
entries: You can infuse your spells with the raw energy of the multiverse. Once per turn, when you cast a spell, you can choose one creature affected by the spell. The target takes an extra 1d8 damage of a type determined by the plane you're channeling (fire for the Elemental Plane of Fire, necrotic for the Shadowfell, etc.). This damage increases to 2d8 at 10th level and 3d8 at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can step into the Ethereal Plane, teleporting up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Upon arrival, you can cast a cantrip as part of the same bonus action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a spell attack, you can disrupt their connection to the current plane. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be banished to a demiplane for 1 minute (the creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns). After using this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Planar Resilience
entries: You gain resistance to damage types associated with other planes (choose two from acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, or radiant) and advantage on saving throws against spells and effects originating from other planes.

subclassFeature.name: Reality Shift
entries: Once per long rest, you can alter reality to match that of another plane for 1 minute. Choose an environment (Fiery, Icy, Stormy, etc.). The area in a 60-foot radius around you transforms to match this environment, granting you and your allies benefits aligned with the chosen plane (e.g., fire immunity in a Fiery environment) and imposing disadvantages on your enemies (e.g., vulnerability to fire in a Fiery environment).

item.name: (Akadi) Frostweaver's Ascendancy
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, +10 charges; on 1, 5 charges; else, 1d12+3 charges up to 15
entries: Crafted from the eternal ice found only in the deepest parts of Akadi's frozen domain and feathers from the rarest air elementals, the Frostweaver's Ascendancy is a staff of unparalleled beauty and power. Its crystalline structure pulses with a soft blue light, and ethereal wings unfold from its shaft when its full might is called upon.

The staff exudes a perpetual chill, leaving a trail of frost where its wielder walks and occasionally stirring a gentle, icy breeze that ruffles the clothes and hair of those nearby. On command, it can intensify this chill, frosting over surfaces and creating a localized snowfall.
This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC.
Attacks made with this staff, or spells cast using it as a focus, deal an additional 1d8 cold damage to their targets.

Frostweaver's Ascendancy holds a pool of 15 charges for invoking its magical abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a d20. On a roll of 20, the staff regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges (for a total of 25 that day). On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains 1d12+3 charges up to a maximum of 15.

entries.name: Icy Mantle
entries: Expend 5 charges to wrap yourself or an ally in a protective mantle of swirling snow and ice for 1 minute, granting resistance to cold damage and disadvantage on melee attacks against them.

entries.name: Blizzard's Call
entries: Plant the staff into the ground and expend 10 charges to summon a localized blizzard in a 60-foot radius centered on the staff for 10 minutes, causing heavy obscuration, difficult terrain, and 2d6 cold damage per turn to enemies within it. The staff must remain planted, and the effect ends if it is removed.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted, piercing through barriers to reveal hidden magic.

item.name: (Akadi) Blizzard's Heart, The Wings of Winter
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Akadi
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, regains all charges and gains an additional 10 charges; on 1, regains 5 charges; else, 1d12+8 charges up to 20
entries: Blizzard's Heart is a divine embodiment of Akadi's mastery over winter's ferocity. Forged in the heart of a never-ending blizzard and cooled in the deepest abyss of the ocean, this staff is encased in ice that never melts and adorned with crystalline formations that shimmer with an inner light.
This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +5 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC.

Attacks made with this staff, or spells cast using it as a focus, deal an additional 2d8 cold damage. The cold is so intense that it can freeze the very air, creating temporary ice structures or hindering foes.

Blizzard's Heart holds a pool of 20 charges for invoking its divine abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a d20. On a roll of 20, the staff regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges. On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains 1d12+8 charges up to a maximum of 20.

entries.name: Winter's Dominion
entries: Expend 7 charges to envelop an area in a 50-foot radius with a fierce winter storm. For 10 minutes, visibility is reduced to 5 feet, and the area becomes difficult terrain. Enemies within the storm take 3d6 cold damage each turn and risk being frozen in place.

entries.name: Frostborne Wings
entries: Expend 10 charges to manifest ethereal wings of ice and snow, granting you a flying speed of 60 feet for 1 hour. While these wings are manifested, your presence chills the air, causing enemies within 30 feet to take 1d6 cold damage at the start of your turn.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted, piercing through barriers to reveal hidden magic.

item.name: (Talos) Bulwark of the Unyielding
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, +10 charges; on 1, 5 charges; else, 1d12+3 charges up to 15
entries: Crafted from arboreal oak and bound with the heart iron of Arborea, this shield stands as a testament to Talos's unwavering resilience and determination. It is adorned with ancient runes of vigilance and persistence that glow in the heat of battle, bolstering the resolve of allies.

While wielding this shield, you gain a +3 bonus to AC and grant advantage on saving throws against effects that cause frightened, paralyzed, blinded or restrained conditions to any number of creatures you choose within your sight.

The shield holds a pool of 15 charges for invoking its magical abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 20, the shield regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges (for a total of 25 that day). On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains {@dice 1d12+3} charges up to a maximum of 15.

entries.name: Rooted She Stands
entries: Expend 4 charges at will to bolster your defense with a +2 AC bonus for 10 minutes as roots from Arborea's wilderness rise to protect you. With each additional activation, the AC bonus increases by +1, but the duration is halved. Upon depleting the charges, you may transform into one of two states:

items: Barkskin Embrace: The roots recede, leaving a protective layer of bark around you. You retain the AC bonus for the remaining duration.

Guardian of Arborea: Your movement becomes 0 as you are encased in a living bulwark of trees, bark, and branches, bursting into vibrant blooms. A tempestuous wind encircles you within a 60-foot radius, and you gain the ability to redirect any ranged attacks within this area towards yourself. The AC bonus from this feature is doubled.

entries.name: Resolve of the Stoic
entries: You have the {@feat shield master|phb} feat for as long as you are attuned to this shield.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted, piercing through barriers to reveal hidden magic.

item.name: (Talos) The Aegis of Arborea
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Talos
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, regains all charges and an additional 10; on 1, regains 10 charges; else, 1d12+8 charges up to 20
entries: The Aegis of Arborea, forged amidst a celestial tempest and nurtured by the vital essence of Arborea, transcends the mere concept of a shield. It embodies Talos's divine guardianship, brimming with the wild essence of untamed nature and emitting a resonant power that echoes the soul of its celestial domain.

While wielding the aegis, you gain a +5 bonus to AC and grant advantage on saving throws against effects that cause frightened, paralyzed, blinded or restrained conditions to any number of creatures you choose within your sight.

The shield holds a pool of 20 charges for invoking its magical abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a d20. On a roll of 20, the shield regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges (for a total of 30 that day). On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains 1d12+8 charges up to a maximum of 15.

entries.name: Guardian's Embrace
entries: As an action for 6 charges, conjure a dome of divine energy and entwined branches around allies within a 30-foot radius. This sanctuary, lasting for 1 minute, grants immunity to non-magical projectiles and advantage on saving throws against magical effects and spells, with attacks able to pass outward unobstructed.

entries.name: Arborea's Call
entries: Spend 12 charges to channel Arborea's primal force, transforming the terrain within 100 feet into a treacherous underbrush that creates difficult terrain and restrains creatures of your choice in it that fail a strength saving throw (DC 20) and deals 2d6 piercing damage at the start of each of thier turns. At the end of its turn, a creature may attempt to free itself by making a strength check (DC 20). Allies gain enhanced mobility, doubling their movement speed and navigating the undergrowth freely.

entries.name: Twin Aegis
entries: Expend 10 charges to summon a spectral duplicate of The Aegis of Arborea. This second shield materializes beside you, granting the ability to either extend its protection or engage in offensive maneuvers. Upon activation, decide between defensive stance or offensive assault:

items: Defender's Ward: The spectral shield orbits to protect an additional ally within 60 feet, granting them +2 bonus to AC and advantage on all saving throws for one minute.

Warrior's Charge: Wielding the spectral shield, you gain a ram ability, allowing you to perform a dash action towards an enemy as a bonus action. On impact, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 20) or be knocked prone and take 4d8 bludgeoning damage. Additionally, you emit a taunting aura at the end of the charge, compelling hostile creatures within 60 feet to target their attacks towards you till the start of your next turn. If a hostile creature within 60ft of you targets a creature other than you it makes the attack at disadvantage.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted, piercing through barriers to reveal hidden magic.

item.name: (Pelor) Radiance of Dawn
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, +10 charges; on 1, 5 charges; else, 1d12+3 charges up to 15
entries: Radiance of Dawn is a divine flail, its head crafted from a solid piece of sunstone and bound with bands of pure gold. Runes of light and order etch its surface, glowing warmly with Pelor's grace. The chain, made from celestial silver, sings with a harmonious tone when swung, symbolizing Pelor's harmonious balance.

In battle, this flail emits a radiant light, illuminating the darkness and revealing hidden truths. Enemies touched by its glow find their shadows receding, unable to hide from Pelor's gaze. The glow from the flail illulinates {@condition invisible} creatures within 30ft.
Wielding this flail grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When used to strike, it deals an additional {@dice 1d8} radiant damage, intensified to {@dice 2d8} against undead creatures.

The flail holds a pool of 15 charges for invoking its magical abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 20, the flail regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges (for a total of 25 that day). On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains {@dice 1d12+3} charges up to a maximum of 15.

entries.name: Luminous Slam
entries: Expend 3 charges to perform a Luminous Slam, channeling Pelor's radiant energy into the ground with a powerful strike. This action creates a wave of purifying light that expands in a 60-foot radius from the point of impact.

items: Radiant Wave: All creatures within the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 20), taking 8d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Undead have disadvantage on this saving throw.
Blinding Radiance: Creatures that fail the saving throw are also blinded until the end of their next turn, overwhelmed by the brilliance of the light.

Sacred Ground: The area affected by the Luminous Slam becomes consecrated for 1 minute. Hostile creatures within this area have their speed halved, and allies gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

If the wave of light encounters reflective surfaces within its radius, it intensifies, granting temporary hit points equal to half the total radiant damage dealt to the wielder and their allies within the area.

entries.name: Divine Illumination
entries: Once per day, without expending charges, the wielder can cause the flail to burst into brilliant sunlight, casting {@spell daylight} as the spell.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted, piercing through barriers to reveal hidden magic.

item.name: (Pelor) Sword of the Sun's Core
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Pelor
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, regains all charges and an additional 10; on 1, regains 10 charges; else, 1d12+5 charges up to 20
entries: Forged from the heart of a celestial sun, this sword radiates with an unyielding light that pierces through the deepest shadows. Its blade, inscribed with ancient scriptures of Pelor, glows with a divine luminescence, offering hope and guidance to those who stand for justice and righteousness.

In the presence of darkness, the sword's light intensifies, casting bright illumination within a 60-foot radius and revealing entities hidden by magic or shadow. This divine light renders {@condition invisible} creatures visible to the wielder.

This sword grants a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Attacks with this sword deal an additional {@dice 2d8} radiant damage. Against undead, the damage increases to {@dice 3d8} radiant, symbolizing Pelor's dominion over light and life.

The sword holds a pool of 20 charges for invoking its magical abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 20, the sword regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges (for a total of 30 that day). On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains {@dice 1d12+8} charges up to a maximum of 20.

entries.name: Concentrated Light Slash
entries: Expend 5 charges to unleash a powerful slash of concentrated light. This radiant arc extends 5 feet wide in a direction you choose, traveling up to 120 feet before dissipating. Creatures caught in its path must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 22), taking {@dice 10d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. For each additional 2 charges, the width increases by 5ft.

items: Reflective: If the arc strikes a reflective surface larger than the arc, it bounces in a new direction.
Purifying Light: Creatures fail the saving throw are illuminated and are unable to benefit from being {@condition invisible}

Solar Empowerment: After unleashing the slash, the sword absorbs residual light energy. Your next attack within 1 minute deals an additional 2d6 radiant damage, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the total damage dealt by this extra attack.

entries.name: Solar Flare
entries: Once per day, without expending charges, the wielder can summon the full power of the sun, enveloping the battlefield in a blinding light. All creatures of your choice within sight must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 22), taking {@dice 10d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half on a success. On spending 5 charges, This divine flare purifies the area, curing creatures of your choice of curses, disease, and poison through a casting of the {@spell greater restoration} spell.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted, piercing through barriers to reveal hidden magic.

item.name: (Eldath) Harmony of Ages
item.reqAttune: by a Bard or follower of Eldath
entries: Harmony of Ages is an ethereal lyre, its existence as timeless as the oldest tales of the Feywild. Crafted from wood that whispers of ancient forests and strings woven from the very threads of time, the instrument's melodies carry the power to bridge worlds and moments. Engraved with depictions of fey dances, serene landscapes, and temporal spirals, it glows with a soft, otherworldly light, inviting its wielder to explore the mysteries of beauty, art, and time.

This artifact bestows upon its wielder the unique ability to weave magic into their music, manipulating time's flow and captivating the hearts of those who hear its divine melodies. Its songs can bend the will of listeners, suggesting actions as if whispered by Eldath herself.

Wielding Harmony of Ages grants a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs for Bard spells. Additionally, it enchants audiences with its performance, allowing the wielder to subject one creature per minute, that can see or hear the performance, to the effect of the {@spell suggestion} spell, with the DC set by the performance check.

The lyre holds a pool of 15 charges for invoking its magical abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 20, the lyre regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges (for a total of 25 that day). On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains {@dice 1d12+3} charges up to a maximum of 15.

entries.name: T# Major
entries: When you use the bardic inspiration featue, expend 5 charges to pluck a chord that weaves through the fabric of time. The wielder can hasten or slow the flow of time for up to 3 creatures within 60ft, offering them an extra bonus action or halving their speed until the end of their next turn. Unwilling targets may resist with a Charisma saving throw against the wielder's spell save DC.

entries.name: Wrath of the Feywild
entries: When you use the bardic inspiration featue, Expend 5 charges to channel the untamed power of the Feywild, releasing its wrath upon the battlefield. Upon activation, the wielder unleashes a surge of fey energy, manifesting one of the following effects, chosen at the time of casting:

items: Feywild Storm: Call down a storm of radiant energy in a 30-foot radius centered on a point within sight. Enemies caught in the storm take {@dice 6d8} radiant damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be blinded till the end of your next turn.

Thorned Grasp: Summon ethereal vines from the ground in a 20-foot square centered within 60ft. These vines lash out at all creatures in the area, dealing {@dice 6d6} piercing damage. Enemies must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be restrained by the entangling vines till the end of your next turn.

Wildfire Dance: Ignites the raw magic of the Feywild to send forth a wave of fire in a 60-foot cone. All creatures caught in the wave take {@dice 8d6} fire damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell saving DC or catch fire, taking an additional {@dice 2d6} fire damage at the start of each of their turns until the the creature uses an action to extinguish it.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: Imbued with the essence of the Feywild, the wielder gains an innate ability to cast *detect magic* at will, without expending a spell slot or charge. This detection is uniquely sensitive to fey magic, revealing the hidden presence of fey creatures or gateways to the Feywild.

item.name: (Eldath) Eternal Serenade
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Eldath
entries: Eternal Serenade is a divine harp, its strings shimmering with the light of stars and its body carved from wood that once formed the core of the Feywild's oldest tree. The harp's melody resonates with the very essence of creation, capable of mending the wounded soul and calming the restless heart. Its music transcends the barriers between worlds, inviting a harmony that echoes Eldath's eternal peace.

Wielding Eternal Serenade grants a +5 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs for Bard spells. Additionally, it enchants audiences with its performance, allowing the wielder to subject one creature per minute, that can see or hear the performance, to the effect of the {@spell suggestion} spell, with the DC set by the performance check.

The harp holds a pool of 20 charges for invoking its magical abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 20, the harp regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges (for a total of 30 that day). On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains {@dice 1d12+8} charges up to a maximum of 20.

entries.name: Melody of the Ages
entries: When you use the bardic inspiration featue, Expend 8 charges to play a tune that weaves through the fabric of time itself. This melody allows the wielder to either accelerate or decelerate time for up to 5 creatures within 60ft. Accelerated allies gain an additional action till the end of thier next turn, while decelerated foes see their speed halved and AC reduced by 10 till the end of your next turn. Unwilling targets may attempt a Charisma saving throw against the wielder's spell save DC to resist.

entries.name: Resonance of the Feywild
entries: When you use the bardic inspiration featue, Expend 5 charges to invoke a symphony of the wild, creating an expansive sanctuary that harmonizes with extraplanar energy. This sanctuary, spanning a 60-foot radius centered on the lyre, lasts for 1 minute and manifests one of the effects as listed below. At anytime, while the santuary is active, you can spend 2 charges to immediately change the effect. You choose one when you activate this feature.

items: Healing Harmony: Allies within the sanctuary heal for {@dice 2d8} hit points at the start of their turn, as the music's soothing tones mend wounds and bolster spirits.
Veil of Serenity: The ground and upto 20ft high becomes difficult terrain for creatures of your choice, as ethereal vines and flowers sprout to slow their advance.

Melodic Guard: Allies in the aura gain {@dice 2d8} temporary hitpoints at the start of thier turns, and on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration on spells, protected by a veil of music that shields their minds.

Resonant Retaliation: When creatures hostile to you within the sanctuary attempt to cast a spell or make an attack, the sanctuary produces a dissonant chord. The attacker must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against the your spell save DC or the attack/spell fails and the caster/attacker takes 1d8 psychic damage, as the sanctuary itself seeks to preserve the peace.

entries.name: Evergreen Harmony
entries: Once per day, without expending charges, the wielder can initiate a performance that invokes Eldath's eternal blessing. This divine melody weaves a continuous aura of tranquility and resilience around the wielder, lasting for 24 hours. Eldath's Evergreen Harmony offers a steadfast connection to the serene and life-giving aspects of Eldath's domain, subtly reinforcing the bond between the natural world and those under its protection.

items: Continuous Protection: Allies within 60 feet of the wielder gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, enveloped in an aura that soothes the mind and fortifies the spirit against manipulation and terror.
Regenerative Melody: The wielder and their allies within the aura regenerate hit points, restoring 1 hit point at the start of each hour.
Harmonic Shield: As a testament to Eldath's guardianship, the aura also grants a +1 bonus to AC to all within its reach, reflecting the protective canopy of a verdant forest.

entries: For each additional charge expended (up to 5), the potency of Eldath's Evergreen Harmony intensifies, enhancing its effects:

items: Each charge increases the hit point regeneration by 1 per hour, up to a maximum of 6 hit points per hour with 5 additional charges spent.
Expend 3 or more additional charges to extend the aura's advantage against charm and fear to include immunity to the poisoned condition and resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: Eternal Serenade sharpens the wielder's awareness of magical energies, allowing them to cast detect magic at will, without expending a spell slot or charge. With an additional charge, the detection becomes omniscient within 60 feet, unveiling even the most hidden magic, including illusions and enchantments.

item.name: (Bhaal) Blade of the Death's Hand
entries: This sinister dagger is forged from a metal that seems to absorb light, with a hilt wrapped in skin from an unknown creature. It is said to have been created in the darkest rituals to Bhaal, infused with the essence of death itself.

While wielding this dagger, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Strikes from this dagger deal an additional {@dice 1d8} necrotic damage, as wounds inflicted fester with supernatural speed, sapping the strength of its victims.

The dagger holds a pool of 15 charges for invoking its magical abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 20, the dagger regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges (for a total of 25 that day). On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains {@dice 1d12+3} charges up to a maximum of 15.

entries.name: Shadow Blink
entries: When you take the attack action, Expend 5 charges to imbue the dagger with a shadowy essence and throw it towards a location within 60 feet. Upon the dagger's impact, you instantly blink to that location, reappearing with the dagger in hand.

entries.name: Decay's Embrace
entries: Expend 3 charges to curse a target that you hit with the weapon. For the next 10 minutes, whenever the cursed target attempts to heal through magical means, they suffer necrotic backlash causing them to take additional necrotic damage equal to half of your weapon damage roll. This curse highlights the insidious influence of Bhaal, turning attempts at recovery into opportunities for further affliction.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted.

item.name: (Bhaal) Eclipse of the End
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Bhaal
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, regains all charges and an additional 10; on 1, regains 10 charges; else, 1d12+5 charges up to 20
entries: Forged under a blood moon, Eclipse of the End is a longsword with a serrated edge that whispers of death's inevitability. Its blade, dark as a moonless night, is rumored to be quenched in the blood of the god's enemies, forever thirsting for the lifeblood of the unwary.

Eclipse of the End grants its wielder a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls and on a critical hit the target suffers an additional {@dice 4d8} necrotic damage as the blade leeches life from them to you, restoring an equivalent amount of your hit points.
The sword holds a reservoir of 20 divine charges, each a promise of demise and despair to those who stand against the wielder's dark purpose.

entries.name: Necrotic Surge
entries: Expend 5 charges to cloak the blade in a shroud of necrotic energy for up to 1 minute as a free action. During this time, each successful hit against a living target causes a surge of necrotic pain. The affected target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 20) or suffer disadvantage on their attacks till the end of thier next turn.

entries.name: Mark of Bhaal
entries: As an action, expend 10 charges to mark a creature within sight. For the next hour, any attack you make against the marked target has a increased crit range of 1. On Expending 5 more charges, the crit range increases to 2. This reduction in crit range stacks with other features that reduce crit range.

entries.name: Siphon Life
entries: Once per day, without expending charges, landing a critical hit with this weapon allows the wielder to absorb the life force of the target, healing for half the total damage dealt. Expending 5 additional charges enhances this effect, granting the wielder temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt for 24 hours.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: The wielder gains an acute sensitivity to the ebb and flow of magical energies, allowing them to cast detect magic at will using 1 charge. This ability is particularly attuned to the detection of necromancy magic, highlighting such auras with a chilling clarity.

item.name: (Diana) Moonlit Sonata
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, +10 charges; on 1, 5 charges; else, 1d12+3 charges up to 15
entries: Forged under the light of a full moon and bathed in the waters of sacred springs, Moonlit Sonata is a shortbow whose string sings with the whispers of the night. Its frame, carved from moon-touched yew, glows faintly in moonlight, illuminating the wielder's path in darkness.
Wielding Moonlit Sonata grants a +3 bonus to attack rolls and inflicts an additional {@dice 1d8} radiant damage, as its arrows are imbued with the luminescence of the moon.

This bow is graced with the touch of Diana, offering guidance under the moon's watchful eye. The wielder and their allies within 30 feet gain enhanced night vision, allowing them to see in dim light as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. Additionally, under the open night sky, the wielder and their allies gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and saving throws against illusions, as the moonlight reveals truths hidden in the shadows.

The shortbow holds a pool of 15 charges for invoking its magical abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wielder rolls a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 20, the shortbow regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges (for a total of 25 that day). On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains {@dice 1d12+3} charges up to a maximum of 15.

entries.name: Lunar Volley
entries: When you take the attack action, Expend 5 charges to unleash a volley of moonlit arrows instead of one of your attacks, each seeking a different target within range. You can attack up to three targets, rolling separately for each attack.

entries.name: Twilight's Embrace
entries: Expend 3 charges to envelop an area in a 20-foot radius within 100 feet in twilight, creating dim light that lasts for 1 hour. Within this area, allies gain advantage on Dexterity(Stealth) checks and enemies suffer disadvantage on perception checks to detect them. Additional effects may be activated upon spending more charges.

items: Spend 5 Charges to give allies a +20 bonus to thier stealth checks
Spend 4 Charges to make this area movable, centered on you and extending out to 40ft instead.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted, embodying Diana's dominion over the night and its secrets.

item.name: (Diana) Celestial Nocturne
item.reqAttune: by a devoted champion of Diana
item.rechargeAmount: 1d20; on 20, regains all charges and an additional 10; on 1, regains 10 charges; else, 1d12+5 charges up to 20
entries: Celestial Nocturne, a divine longbow, was Diana's gift to her most faithful. Crafted under a lunar eclipse, its limbs are made from silvered wood that reflects the moon's phases. The bowstring, spun from moonlight, emits a soft glow, casting shadows that dance like twilight spirits.

Wielding Celestial Nocturne grants a +5 bonus to attack rolls and deals an additional {@dice 2d8} radiant damage, as its arrows are blessed by Diana's light. The bow enhances the wielder's affinity with the moon, allowing them to draw upon its various phases for guidance and strength.

This bow is graced with the touch of Diana, offering guidance under the moon's watchful eye. The wielder and their allies within 30 feet gain enhanced night vision, allowing them to see in dim light as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. Additionally, under the open night sky, the wielder and their allies gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and saving throws against illusions, as the moonlight reveals truths hidden in the shadows.
hold scharges

entries.name: Moonbeam Volley
entries: When you take the attack action, you may replace one of your attacks with a volley of moon beam. Expend 6 charges and shoot towards the sky to conjure beams of pure moonlight that strike from above, targeting up to five creatures within 100 feet. Roll to hit for each creature. On a hit, each creature takes {@dice 4d10} radiant damage.

entries.name: Lunar Requiem
entries: Expend 5 charges to summon a cascade of lunar energy, enveloping an ally within 60 feet in a radiant, protective cocoon. For 10 minutes, this Requiem grants the ally a +2 AC and advantage on saving throws against spells. More so, if the ally is reduced to 0 hit points while under the Requiem's effect, they are instead restored to 1 hit point and gain temporary hit points equal to 5d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier, as a burst of moonlight energy revitalizes them. This revival effect can only trigger once per use of Lunar Requiem.

Additionally, while under the effects of Lunar Requiem, the ally's appearance becomes ethereal, with a soft, moonlit glow surrounding them. This glow illuminates a 10-foot radius, allowing the ally to see in darkness as if it were dim light.

entries.name: Twilight Dominion
entries: Without expending charges, create a 40-foot radius of twilight around you for 1 hour once per day. This domain grants invisibility to you and your allies as long as you remain still and silent within it. Spending 5 additional charges extends the radius to 60 feet and allows movement within the domain without breaking invisibility.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled, and spending another charge makes your detection capabilities uninterrupted, offering insight into the hidden magics that illuminate or lurk within the night.

item.name: (Erathis) Mantle of the Ethereal Order
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, paladin, or any lawful alignment
entries: This divine mantle is woven from the threads of celestial fabric, infused with the essence of law and purity. It shimmers with a soft light, reflecting Erathis's commitment to order, and is adorned with symbols of her dominion over the Material Plane. Those who drape the Mantle of the Ethereal Order over their shoulders feel an overwhelming sense of purpose and clarity, driven to uphold the principles of civilization and harmony.

Wearing this mantle grants a +50 bonus to Max health. The wearer is also imbued with a serene aura that calms chaos and discord, radiating an influence of peace and order. This mantle creates an aura of 5ft that applies the effects of {@spell calm emotions} continously. In initiative, it casts calm emotions at the start of your turn.

The mantle enhances the wearer's diplomatic abilities, granting advantage on Persuasion and Insight checks. This effect symbolizes Erathis's role in fostering communication and understanding among civilizations.

The mantle holds a pool of 15 charges for invoking its divine abilities. At the beginning of each day, the wearer rolls a d20. On a roll of 20, the mantle regains all spent charges and gains an additional 10 charges. On a roll of 1, it regains 5 charges. Otherwise, it regains 1d12+3 charges up to a maximum of 15.

entries.name: Harmony's Call
entries: Expend 5 charges to release a surge of calming energy in a 30-foot radius centered on the mantle. For 1 minute, this wave seeks to quell aggression, offering creatures within the area a moment of clarity and peace. Affected creatures must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw(DC 20) or be compelled to use their next turn to take no action that involves direct harm to others, such as attacking or casting harmful spells. Instead, they may move, use a non-aggressive action, or attempt to communicate peacefully.
Creatures that successfully save against this effect are immune to Harmony's Call for 24 hours. This ability does not affect creatures that are immune to being charmed.

entries.name: Architect's Insight
entries: Expend 3 charges to activate Architect's Insight for 10 minutes. Upon activation, you and your allies within a 30-foot radius gain unparalleled clarity and focus.
During this time, all affected creatures gain the following benefits:

items: Clear vision upto 2 miles.
Double proficiency bonus on skill checks related to crafting, building, or strategizing.
Creatures attempting to deceive or outmaneuver you within this radius have their intentions subtly revealed by Erathis’s light, granting you a +5 bonus to Insight checks against such deceptions.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: The mantle sharpens the wearer's perception of magical auras, allowing them to cast *detect magic* at will, without expending a spell slot or charge. The detection is particularly sensitive to illusions and enchantments, revealing the truths that lie beneath the surface.

item.name: (Erathis) Cloak of the Founding Order
item.reqAttune: by a cleric, paladin, or any lawful alignment
entries: The Cloak of the Founding Order is a celestial artifact, woven from the very essence of order and the foundational energies of the cosmos. It radiates with a divine light that structures chaos and illuminates the path toward civilization's zenith. Adorned with sacred geometries and symbols of the first cities, it empowers its wearer to shape the world according to Erathis' vision.

Wearing this cloak grants a +100 bonus to Max health. The wearer is also imbued with a serene aura that calms chaos and discord, radiating an influence of peace and order. This cloak creates an aura of 5ft that applies the effects of {@spell calm emotions} continously. In initiative, it casts calm emotions at the start of your turn.
This divine arm holds a reservoir of 20 charges, tapping into the primordial power of creation and law. Charges are replenished daily, with a unique mechanism reflecting the divine will.

entries.name: Decree of Order
entries: If you have more than 10 charges, as an action you can expend all remaining charges to issue a divine decree in a 60-foot radius. For 1 minute, this decree enforces a magical contract of non-aggression, preventing any creature from initiating combat or casting spells intended to harm others. Those who attempt to break this contract must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC 20) or be rendered incapacitated for the duration, as they are overwhelmed by a compulsion to maintain peace.

entries.name: Blueprints of Creation
entries: Expend 3 charges to cast a spell from a curated list of creation and crafting spells without using a spell slot. This list includes *fabricate*, *wall of stone*, and *create or destroy water*, reflecting Erathis's domain over invention and civilization. Each casting uses a set number of charges, allowing for multiple uses throughout the day.

items: Fabricate (4 charges)
Wall of Stone (5 charges)
Create or Destroy Water (2 charges)

entries.name: Covenant of the Just
entries: Without expending charges, the wearer can invoke a covenant once per day. This covenant blesses an area of up to 100 feet in radius, lasting for 10 minutes. Within this sanctified ground, allies gain resistance to damage from chaotic creatures and advantage on saving throws against enchantments and illusions. Expending additional charges (up to 10) can extend the duration or amplify the resistances to include damage from any source not aligned with lawful good.

items: 5 additional charges extend the duration by 10 minutes.
10 additional charges grant immunity to damage from chaotic creatures.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: The cloak sharpens the wearer's perception of magical auras, allowing them to cast *detect magic* at will, without expending a spell slot or charge. This ability is especially attuned to detecting magic that upholds or disrupts order, highlighting the forces that shape or threaten the foundations of civilization.

item.name: (Ioun) Ápeiro, the Keen Mantle
item.reqAttune: by a wizard or a creature with the spellcasting feature
entries: This cloak was forged in the divine realms and entrusted to a hero who was on a quest to quell the consequence of the Arcane Aftermath. This Cloak was one of three boons that graced the world after the reality morphing event changed the face Fer.

The cloak in apprance resembles an old, grey mantle with a cape of velvet cloth. Plain grey with a belt of a darker grey. It's jagged at the edges and it looks like it was torn at the base. The wearer feels eons of knowledge coursing through the cloak. Arcane scribblings come to you instantly as if the cloak made of parchment. You can use the cloak to channel any {@filter Wizard spell of lvl5 and below|spells|level=1|level=2|level=3|level=4|level=5|class=Wizard} once a day and cast it without material components. As long as you are wearing this cloak and have enough materials, you can copy the channeled spell into your spellbook.
While you are wearing this cloak, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. You also ignore half and three quarters cover when making a spell attack.
Additionally, you gain expertise in any one of the intelligence skills you are proficient in.

This cloak has a pool of 15 charges when attuned to. Charges can be spent to do a number of things. At the end of a long rest, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 20, it regains all charges and has an additional 10 charges. On a 1, it regains 5 charges. On other rolls, it regains {@dice 1d12+3} charges upto 15.

entries.name: Knowledge of the eons
entries: You get the {@feat keen mind} feat as long as you are attuned to this cloak. If you already have the keen mind feat, you may choose a different feat while you attune to it. You may choose a different feat everytime you attune to this cloak but you must meet the pre-requisites for the feat.

entries.name: Offensive barrier
entries: After a long rest, when you roll to regain charges, choose an element type and the cloak attunes to it. For the rest of the day, you are immune to this damage type, and when you cast a spell that rolls damage die of that element, the damage ignores resistance and immunity of the affected creature.

Additionally, When you roll for damage of the attuned type, you can spend 1 charge to reroll a number of the damage dice up to 4+Spell level. You must use the new rolls. If the damage type is different, you can reroll upto 4 damage dice.

As a bonus action/Reaction(when you take damage) you can spend 4 charges to gain resistance to another element and gain the benefits of casting spells of that type. Doing so will drop your immunity to the first damage type.

entries.name: Arcane Sentinel
entries: You always know the spell detect magic and can cast it using 1 charge. The radius is doubled and on spending another charge, your range becomes uninterrupted.

entries.name: Vicinity breeds affinity, affinity breeds power, power yearns vicinity.
entries: As long as one of the other 2 weapons of the arcane aftermath get within 1000ft of this weapon, the creature attuned to it always knows the direction to the weapon.

Once all three weapons of the arcane aftermath are within 30ft of eachother, they fuse with the creatures they are attuned to. All creatures attuned to these weapons recieve a +2 to any ability of thier choice. Make the following changes to Ápeiro.

items: Spell attack rolls bonus increases to a +4 and Spell Save DC increases to a +4.

Arcane Absorption. If you cast a spell that requires concentration while you already concentrating on a spell, the initial spell doesn't drop but instead becomes duration-based for half the concentration duration.

item.name: (Ioun) Omniscience Cloak, the Infinite Wisdom
item.reqAttune: by a wizard, sorcerer, or any spellcaster devoted to Ioun
entries: Woven from the fabric of reality itself and the essence of the Weave, this cloak embodies the pinnacle of arcane mastery and the vast expanse of knowledge guarded by Ioun. It shimmers with a spectrum of colors, each shift revealing new patterns of arcane runes.
While wearing this cloak, you have a +5 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. Additionally, you can bypass any form of magical resistance or immunity when casting spells.

Omniscience Cloak, the Infinite Wisdom holds 30 charges for its divine abilities, focused on revealing secrets, enhancing magical prowess, and manipulating the Weave. It regains 1d20+10 charges at dawn.

entries.name: Weave's Dominion
entries: Expend 10 charges to gain unparalleled control over the Weave for 10 minutes. During this time, you can cast spells without verbal, somatic, or material components (if they cost less than 500 gp), and you can alter one aspect of any spell's effects (such as its color, shape, duration, or damage type).

entries.name: Arcane Reservoir
entries: As an action, expend 15 charges to tap into a deep reservoir of arcane energy. For the next hour, you regain one expended spell slot up to 5th level at the start of each of your turns.

entries.name: Insight of the Ages
entries: You gain the ability to cast 'legend lore' and 'foresight' each once per long rest, without expending a spell slot or incurring any material costs.

entries.name: Confluence of Thought
entries: The cloak enhances your mental faculties to their utmost potential. You gain proficiency in all Intelligence-based skills. If you are already proficient in these skills, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses any of those skills.

entries.name: Cosmic Synergy
entries: In the presence of the other two divine arms of the arcane aftermath, the cloak's power is magnified. You can choose to activate a link with these items, allowing you to share spells and abilities cast from them as if you were the caster, extending their range and effects to encompass your shared battlefield.

item.name: (Tiamat) Backbiter, The existential Crisis
entries: This dagger was forged in the divine realms and entrusted to a hero who was on a quest to quell the consequence of the Arcane Aftermath. This Dagger was one of four weapons that graced the world after the reality morphing event changed the face of Fer.

This dagger shines as if it's made of satin fabric and yet, looks like it has an edge that can cut through bone. This blade shifts in and out of visibility for everyone except the one holding and attuned to it. Anyone who cannot see the dagger directly forgets about it's existence and all memories associated with it are rationalised into different narratives.
You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra {@dice 1d8} Necrotic damage as the wound seeps with dark energies of the 9 hells

This dagger has a pool of 15 charges when attuned to. Charges can be spent to do a number of things. At the begining of a day, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 20, it regains all charges and has an additional 10 charges. On a 1, it regains 5 charges. On other rolls, it regains {@dice 1d12+3} charges upto 15.

entries.name: In Baator, Hide
entries: In darkness, dim light or in Baator, the dagger draws in the shadows and clouds you from the untrained eye. While this is in effect, and if you have advantage on Dexterity checks, you can reroll one of the dice once.

entries.name: Rend Memory
entries: As an action, you can spend 2 charges to feint the target and make an attack against the target.
